headline: Business Lookahead: Rate decisions, business activity surveys
summary: STORY: From central bank meetings to reports from some of the "Magnificent Seven," these are the stories to watch in business and finance in the coming week.:: Look Ahead:: Set to pauseThe European Central Bank is set to pause on Thursday after eight consecutive rate cuts halved its policy rate to 2%.It comes as a 30% U.S. tariff threat looms over the euro zone.Policymakers will be reluctant to create the sense that they are reacting to a threat, but they’ll have to reassess their worst case scenario from June, which foresaw a lower tariff level.:: Earnings in earnestMore than one-fifth of S&P 500 companies are expected to report in the coming week.Market heavyweights Alphabet and Tesla are the first of the “Magnificent Seven” to report this period.:: Coca-ColaResults are also due from Coca-Cola, IBM and Phillip Moris International.:: Business timeJuly surveys of business activity across the globe may capture shifts in behavior in both services and manufacturing in response to Trump’s new August 1 tariff deadline.Twenty-two of the world’s 34 largest economies have slowing activity, leaving the services sector to do much of the heavy lifting.In June, services activity in the U.S., euro zone, China and Germany were slower than in December, and well below last June.Among richer nations, only Japan and Britain saw a year-on-year improvement in service-sector activity last month.:: Turkey’s central bankTurkey’s central bank is expected to return to rate cuts on Thursday.That's after the March detention of Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu roiled markets, knocked the lira to a record low, saw stocks trading suspended and prompted the central bank to hike overnight rates to 46%.A Reuters poll showed expectations for a 250-basis point cut, with some predicting as much as 350 bps.Central banks in Hungary and Russia also hold rate meetings in the coming week.

raw.headline: Business Lookahead: Rate decisions, business activity surveys
raw.summary: STORY: From central bank meetings to reports from some of the "Magnificent Seven," these are the stories to watch in business and finance in the coming week.:: Look Ahead:: Set to pauseThe European Central Bank is set to pause on Thursday after eight consecutive rate cuts halved its policy rate to 2%.It comes as a 30% U.S. tariff threat looms over the euro zone.Policymakers will be reluctant to create the sense that they are reacting to a threat, but they’ll have to reassess their worst case scenario from June, which foresaw a lower tariff level.:: Earnings in earnestMore than one-fifth of S&P 500 companies are expected to report in the coming week.Market heavyweights Alphabet and Tesla are the first of the “Magnificent Seven” to report this period.:: Coca-ColaResults are also due from Coca-Cola, IBM and Phillip Moris International.:: Business timeJuly surveys of business activity across the globe may capture shifts in behavior in both services and manufacturing in response to Trump’s new August 1 tariff deadline.Twenty-two of the world’s 34 largest economies have slowing activity, leaving the services sector to do much of the heavy lifting.In June, services activity in the U.S., euro zone, China and Germany were slower than in December, and well below last June.Among richer nations, only Japan and Britain saw a year-on-year improvement in service-sector activity last month.:: Turkey’s central bankTurkey’s central bank is expected to return to rate cuts on Thursday.That's after the March detention of Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu roiled markets, knocked the lira to a record low, saw stocks trading suspended and prompted the central bank to hike overnight rates to 46%.A Reuters poll showed expectations for a 250-basis point cut, with some predicting as much as 350 bps.Central banks in Hungary and Russia also hold rate meetings in the coming week.

headline: Global Quantum Computing Market Report 2025: Revenue, Trends, and Key Players

Analyzing trends, market revenue, and projections from 2024 to 2030, it covers industry dynamics, ESG developments, and profiles of leading companies like IBM, Google, and Amazon. Optimize your strategy with detailed data tables, market size forecasts, and patent analyses, while exploring emerging technologies and regional insights across North America, Europe, and Asia-Pacific.
